ReviewText: The product is truly exceptional in terms of both aesthetics and functionality, showcasing a level of craftsmanship that is rare in today's market. It exceeded my expectations in every way, making it a delight to use daily. However, the shipping process was incredibly slow and lacked proper communication from the carrier, which was quite frustrating given the anticipation of receiving such a high-quality item.

ReviewText:
For what it is, it's a neat little machine and I applaud the company for trying to innovate by creating a small, single barrel washer that isn't $300. Unfortunately, there are draw backs with that reduction in cost.

I did a few loads: underwear/delicates, and mixed items (about an outfit worth).

Positive attributes: Small, washes clothes well, light weight, easy to use, nice medium between a totally manual machine and an automated one.

Negative attributes: water leaks down the sides, (even when water is only filled half way), spinning drum detaches no matter how much or how evenly weighted it is, clothes don't spin out very dry, (they're not dripping wet, but still heavy with water)

Segments.SegmentText: it's a neat little machine and I applaud the company for trying to innovate by creating a small, single barrel washer that isn't $300

water leaks down the sides, (even when water is only filled half way), spinning drum detaches no matter how much or how evenly weighted it is, clothes don't spin out very dry, (they're not dripping wet, but still heavy with water)

ReviewText: This works really well, and it makes Sonic ice! However, I do wish that I could attach a water line. I have a regular ice maker that is hooked up and works all the time, but this one requires manual loading and draining so I only use it for special occasions. Overall, it's a lot of extra work and I rarely use it because of that. I may end up buying a replacement that can be left connected.

Segments.SegmentText: This works really well, and it makes Sonic ice!
I do wish that I could attach a water line
this one requires manual loading and draining so I only use it for special occasions.

ReviewText: So far so good, only issues, it looked used. Lock tab for hot water valve was worn down, see pic. Also, hot water valve is misaligned, see pic. Didn't notice till after install. So i went with it. Will update if it works better than it looks. Install was easy, looks like a good replacement part. Update, been a few weeks, working great still, so only issue is cosmetic.

Segments.SegmentText: Install was easy, looks like a good replacement part.
Lock tab for hot water valve was worn down
hot water valve is misaligned

ReviewText: If you're searching for this, you know what it is. My gas range is the standard 36" range with built-in oven that is found in many homes. Nothing fancy. The problem is that there is a small gap between the range and the cabinet/countertop that food or liquid can fall into. These Stainless Steel Stove Gap Covers solves exactly this problem. Due to its proximity to the fire and heat, the gap cover must be metal and because will be exposed to oils and other food particles, it needs to be easy-to-clean. These covers fit both criteria. With an extendable piece, these covers can fit all ranges regardless of the depth of the stove and there is a small metal piece that is supposed to provide tension when inserted into the gap. Unfortunately, this is where I have the first problem with this product. The tension just isn't enough to keep the gap cover in the gap snugly. I think a cork or silicone piece would help give it the friction in needs to stay in place. The second problem I have is that the product is in the shape of the letter "T" but because there is a slight difference in height between my range and the counter, it has to tilt to one side, further making it hard for the cover to stay in place. The last issue is the extension part. It doesn't lock into a position. Without it, you can accidentally push on the cover and shorten it. It would be better to have some sort of locking mechanism that will keep it to the length that you set. This product does what its intended for, but I think a few tweaks and it would be perfect (I might just look to see if I can make these tweaks myself).

Segments.SegmentText: These Stainless Steel Stove Gap Covers solves exactly this problem.
These covers fit both criteria. With an extendable piece, these covers can fit all ranges regardless of the depth of the stove.
The tension just isn't enough to keep the gap cover in the gap snugly. I think a cork or silicone piece would help give it the friction in needs to stay in place.

The second problem I have is that the product is in the shape of the letter because there is a slight difference in height between my range and the counter, it has to tilt to one side, further making it hard for the cover to stay in place. The last issue is the extension part. It doesn't lock into a position. Without it, you can accidentally push on the cover and shorten it. It would be better to have some sort of locking mechanism that will keep it to the length that you set.

ReviewText: This thing worked for a while and then the sensor quit being 'tricked' by it. Once that continued we re-evaluated our need for a Keurig and decided just to go back to a standard coffee pot. Keurigs are expensive, pods are expensive and you can't clean the damn machine out. Its all a waste. At least this reusable filter was somewhat helpful, but we are much happier with our $20 12 cup coffee pot that works faster than the single serving Keurig ever did.

ReviewText: Our ancient range finally expired. This range was recommended to me by a salesperson at an appliance store near me. It looks good. The burners are a bit too powerful for the home cook IMHO. Something I've noticed is that the burners will heat food unevenly, as in a cast iron pan of scrambled eggs will cook faster on one side. This is without any fan on in the kitchen. Does that sound right to you? So I have to rotate pans 180 degrees. This is annoying. There's a tiny burner at the center of the right burner which I couldn't figure out, then eventually turned the tiny cap a bit and it lit and stayed on. It's actually kind of useful. The oven racks SUCK, they're impossible to pull in and out, they have odd little metal balls that just do not cooperate, major fail. And the halogen lights in the oven are ugly as sin, dismal North Korean prison camp type of light. The oven has been satisfactory. I do like the big iron grates.

Segments.SegmentText: It looks good. There's a tiny burner at the center of the right burner which I couldn't figure out, then eventually turned the tiny cap a bit and it lit and stayed on. It's actually kind of useful.

The burners are a bit too powerful for the home cook IMHO. The burners will heat food unevenly, as in a cast iron pan of scrambled eggs will cook faster on one side. The oven racks SUCK, they're impossible to pull in and out, they have odd little metal balls that just do not cooperate.
The halogen lights in the oven are ugly as sin, dismal North Korean prison camp type of light.

ReviewText: Well I don't usually leave reviews but felt I needed to on this one as a public service announcement. The kit worked fine however the screws supplied did not fit in any of the predrilled holes. The brackets were fine and the plastic parts. I happen to carry many different kinds of screws that fit almost any need for a DIYer, so I was able to manage. That being said if my kit was a fluke this is more of a venting mechanism because it is frustrating to have figure it out when the proper materials are not sent. Truth be told I went this route because it was $5 cheaper then OEM. Goes to show you sometimes you get what you pay for.

Segments.SegmentText: The kit worked fine however the screws supplied did not fit in any of the predrilled holes.
The brackets were fine and the plastic parts.

ReviewText: KEURIG K-EXPRESS ESSENTIALS FROM WAL-MART. If you have this model that was put out by walmart. Your cartridges will fit but the holder won't. Too bad I don't have tools cause I think I could make mine work. Here is what I believe to be the problem. At bottom tank where you would insert holder over screen. There is too much space to clip in its simply too tall/deep for holder to clip in. If I could cut extra off would fit. This isn't sellers design issue, as from what can tell will fit other models. Im gonna measure see if can find one. If not will gift cartridges on to another person.

Segments.SegmentText: Your cartridges will fit but the holder won't.

ReviewText: If you purchase any of the Broan hoods in this series do not install halogen bulbs - you will need to disassemble the hood to change the bulbs when they burn out. Install LED bulbs and hopefully you will move or die before they need to be replaced. The plastic housing for the light socket is weak and will likely break when you try to remove a spent bulb. You will give up the lower light setting but it is worth it.

Segments.SegmentText: If you purchase any of the Broan hoods in this series do not install halogen bulbs - you will need to disassemble the hood to change the bulbs when they burn out.
The plastic housing for the light socket is weak and will likely break when you try to remove a spent bulb.

ReviewText: Tricky to use, but coffee tastes good! I had to read a lot of reviews and mess with my brewer a lot to get these to work. Turns out the trick was to keep trying by pushing the cup as far into the holder as possible and quickly closing it. Eventually it read as compatible and didn’t give an error message. I normally use a clip that lets me use any old cup, but it doesn’t work for the carafe size cups as they require a different color, so I had to remove it from my machine. Coffee tastes good and they were fairly easy to clean. I just wish it was a bit less fiddly. It seems like the spring pushes the cup back up out of the holder a bit, so it takes a lot of tries to get it pushed in far enough not to freak out the brewer.

Segments.SegmentText: It seems like the spring pushes the cup back up out of the holder a bit, so it takes a lot of tries to get it pushed in far enough not to freak out the brewer.

ReviewText: Great little pour over filter, with some problems. I drink pour over coffee almost exclusively, and wanted to get away from the disposable filters. This looked just like what I needed, so I got it. It has a lot of good features: super easy to use and clean, and it looks nice too, and doesn't take up too much space. The screen is very fine, so no coffee grounds got through. The screen is so fine--yet works so well--that I suspect I could even use this on rooibos tea, which is very fine indeed. On to the problems. The silicone (rubber?) ring around the base was half off when it came out of the package. I couldn't get it back on. It doesn't really matter in terms of operation, but kind of not a good idea to have something breaking right out of the package. I also don't get why the coffee scoop has a brush on the end of it. For cleaning the screen I guess, but it seems odd to me to have it on the end of the coffee scoop, and frankly, it didn't help with cleaning it all (but the mesh did just rinse clean). I don't really see this thing lasting that long. Finally, as others have noted, it makes a fairly weak cup of coffee. I have another cup filter like this that doesn't start filtering until you put it on the cup, which means you can let it brew a longer. I much prefer that filter to this one, although that one uses disposable filters. There may be a trick to learning to do a good pour-over, so perhaps my complaints reflect that, but for now, I think I'll keep using my other filter with the new reusable linen filters I found on Amazon. I might use this to filter tea after I've steeped it in a pot--it is a great fine mesh filter. But overall, this doesn't quite suit my needs.

Segments.SegmentText: It has a lot of good features: super easy to use and clean, and it looks nice too, and doesn't take up too much space. The screen is very fine, so no coffee grounds got through.
The silicone (rubber?) ring around the base was half off when it came out of the package. I couldn't get it back on.
I also don't get why the coffee scoop has a brush on the end of it
I might use this to filter tea after I've steeped it in a pot--it is a great fine mesh filter

ReviewText: This SS-10 brewer is ok, but it's no SS-700. I bought the Cuisinart SS-10 to replace our SS-700, Cuisinart's previous model 1 cup brewer. The SS-700 lasted almost 6 1/2 years, which is far better than my earlier 1 cup units. Unfortunately, I have to say the SS-700 was better. For one thing, when you close the SS-10's handle on a K-cup, it feels and sounds like the mechanism is about to break. It feels flimsy. Plus, the SS-700 allowed you to select a brewing temperature between 187 and 192 degrees F, and the coffee was HOT. The SS-10 has only HOT and XHOT selections and, sadly, even with the XHOT setting the coffee temp measures only 140 degrees. Once I add creamer it's down to 130. That's barely warm. In just a few minutes I'm looking to nuke the cup in the microwave. On a lesser note, I miss the SS-700's blue LEDs shining up into the water reservoir, making it easier to see the current level. And did I mention the SS-10 holds 10% less water? On the plus side, the SS-10 is quieter than the SS-700, but who really cares?

Segments.SegmentText: For one thing, when you close the SS-10's handle on a K-cup, it feels and sounds like the mechanism is about to break.
The coffee temp measures only 140 degrees, barely warm. In just a few minutes I'm looking to nuke the cup in the microwave.

ReviewText: You get what you pay for. I purchased this several weeks ago. Overall, I'm content with the unit for the price. The previous reviews here on Amazon were accurate, so I won't repeat what's already been said. The main thing I'll add is that the door bounces back open if you close it with even moderate force. Multiple times I've come back to find that the door was ajar. I tested it to make sure - you have to close the door gently, so don't be in a hurry when you're grabbing a drink. I'm considering adding a couple of magnets to the door, but not sure if there's an easy way to do it. The noise level is also an issue, so take that into consideration before you purchase this unit. We have it in a room where the noise isn't a concern. I wouldn't want this in a living room or den, where the noise would be a distraction.

Segments.SegmentText: I'm content with the unit for the price.
The door bounces back open if you close it with even moderate force. The noise level is also an issue.

ReviewText: This ice machine is a lifesaver during hot summers! However, it is a bit noisy when operating, and the ice sometimes clumps together. But overall, it delivers quick ice and has been reliable during the heatwaves. It's compact enough to fit on my counter without taking too much space. Definitely a must-have for anyone who loves cold drinks and hosting parties!

Segments.SegmentText: This ice machine is a lifesaver during hot summers! It delivers quick ice and has been reliable during the heatwaves. It's compact enough to fit on my counter without taking too much space.

ReviewText: I was excited to try this new grill, but it was a letdown. The assembly instructions were confusing, and some parts didn't seem to fit together properly. After finally getting it assembled, the grill didn't heat evenly, and the food ended up charred in some areas and undercooked in others. I contacted customer support, and they were unhelpful, providing generic troubleshooting tips that didn't resolve the issue. Ultimately, I returned the grill and purchased a different model from another brand.

ReviewText: I purchased this microphone specifically for Discord and in-game voice chats. It has a sturdy metal construction and delivers excellent sound quality. The microphone's swivel feature is really handy since you can swivel the head out of the way so it doesn't cover the monitor.

ReviewText: The brush is really nice, good craftsmanship with a thick substantial handle.  It deserves to be loved, but only if you're right-handed.  The way the bristles are angled makes the brush upside-down in a left hand.  Sure, you can use the long bristles, but that defeats the purpose of the angle which really does make the brush go through whiskers more easily.  We Southpaws are very used to this.  So many products designed to fit in a hand are made for the right hand, which makes them awkward or ineffective (like scissors) for 10% of us.  When that happens, I find that I don't reach for that item as often, or I avoid it altogether, and, sadly, this fine brush sits seldom-used in my bathroom.  Maybe some future version could have the peak of the bristles in the middle with an angle on both sides.

Segments.SegmentText: The brush is really nice, good craftsmanship with a thick substantial handle

but that defeats the purpose of the angle which really does make the brush go through whiskers more easily.  We Southpaws are very used to this.  So many products designed to fit in a hand are made for the right hand, which makes them awkward or ineffective (like scissors) for 10% of us.  When that happens, I find that I don't reach for that item as often, or I avoid it altogether, and, sadly, this fine brush sits seldom-used in my bathroom.

ReviewText: Overall, I'm happy with this product. It fits my blender well and does a good job of blending my smoothies. However, I did notice that it's a bit louder than the original blender blade that came with my blender. It's not a dealbreaker for me, but it's something to consider if you're sensitive to noise.

Segments.SegmentText: It's not a dealbreaker for me, but it's something to consider if you're sensitive to noise.

ReviewText: I bought this product hoping it would help me organize my closet, but it didn't work out as I had hoped. The hangers are flimsy and don't hold heavy clothes well. They also take up more space than I expected. I ended up returning them and looking for a sturdier solution.

Segments.SegmentText: The hangers are flimsy and don't hold heavy clothes well.
They also take up more space than I expected.

ReviewText: It's has some good sports but it's got like 4 games for 4 players. Nothing spectacular. The old Nintendo sports was better. It has been lost in the drawer in our house, as for the low interest.

Segments.SegmentText: It's has some good sports but it's got like 4 games for 4 players.

ReviewText: I'm not impressed with this vacuum cleaner. It's not very powerful and doesn't seem to pick up dirt and debris as well as my old vacuum. The attachments also feel flimsy and are difficult to attach securely. I wouldn't recommend this product.

Segments.SegmentText: The attachments also feel flimsy and are difficult to attach securely.

ReviewText: This coffee maker is a disappointment. It takes forever to brew a pot of coffee, and when it finally finishes, the coffee isn't even that hot. Plus, the carafe drips every time I pour a cup. I expected better quality from this brand.

Segments.SegmentText: Plus, the carafe drips every time I pour a cup.
I expected better quality from this brand.

ReviewText: I was excited to try this new shampoo, but unfortunately, it didn't work well for me. It left my hair feeling greasy and weighed down, even after multiple washes. I also didn't care for the scent. I'll be sticking with my old shampoo.

Segments.SegmentText: It left my hair feeling greasy and weighed down, even after multiple washes.
I also didn't care for the scent.

ReviewText: I love this electric kettle! It boils water quickly and is easy to use. The temperature control feature is great for making different types of tea, and the design looks sleek on my countertop. Highly recommend!

Segments.SegmentText: The temperature control feature is great for making different types of tea, and the design looks sleek on my countertop.

ReviewText: I'm disappointed with this phone case. It looked nice when I first got it, but it started to yellow after only a few weeks of use. It also doesn't provide much protection for my phone. I wouldn't purchase it again.

Segments.SegmentText: It also doesn't provide much protection for my phone.

ReviewText: This microwave is fantastic! It heats food evenly and quickly, and the controls are intuitive to use. The stainless steel exterior is easy to clean and looks great in my kitchen. I highly recommend this model.

Segments.SegmentText: This microwave is fantastic! It heats food evenly and quickly, and the controls are intuitive to use.
The stainless steel exterior is easy to clean and looks great in my kitchen.

ReviewText: This desk chair is uncomfortable to sit in for long periods. The cushioning is too firm and doesn't provide enough support for my lower back. I wish I had spent a little more money on a better quality chair.

Segments.SegmentText: The cushioning is too firm and doesn't provide enough support for my lower back.

ReviewText: I'm very impressed with this air purifier. It's quiet, efficient, and has made a noticeable difference in the air quality of my home. I've noticed fewer allergy symptoms since using it. Plus, it's sleek and doesn't take up much space.

Segments.SegmentText: I'm very impressed with this air purifier. It's quiet, efficient, and has made a noticeable difference in the air quality of my home.
Plus, it's sleek and doesn't take up much space.

ReviewText: I love these wireless headphones! The sound quality is excellent, and they're comfortable to wear for long periods. The battery life is impressive, and I appreciate the convenience of not having to deal with tangled cords. Highly recommend!

Segments.SegmentText: I love these wireless headphones! The sound quality is excellent, and they're comfortable to wear for long periods.
The battery life is impressive, and I appreciate the convenience of not having to deal with tangled cords.

ReviewText: I purchased this vacuum cleaner after reading positive reviews online, but I've been disappointed with its performance. It doesn't pick up pet hair as well as I had hoped, and the suction power seems weak. The attachments also keep falling off during use, which is frustrating. I'm considering returning it.

Segments.SegmentText: I purchased this vacuum cleaner after reading positive reviews online, but I've been disappointed with its performance.
It doesn't pick up pet hair as well as I had hoped, and the suction power seems weak.
The attachments also keep falling off during use, which is frustrating.

ReviewText: Good build quality,light weight,comfortable and good sound quality

Segments.SegmentText: Good build quality,light weight,comfortable and good sound quality

ReviewText: These are incredibly comfortable and have an amazing battery life and amazing sound. Din't take long to charge either. I'd definitely buy them again!

Segments.SegmentText: These are incredibly comfortable and have an amazing battery life and amazing sound.

ReviewText: I bought this for my Maytag Quiet Series 300. This model has 3 racks. This basket is a little large for the space set aside for the utensil basket on the middle shelf and it doesn't fit well over the spikes that are there to support it. I bought this because one of the reviews said it would fit my model “perfectly”. It does not. But, I liked the weight and sturdiness of the basket so I let the moveable spikes down flat and put the utensil basket at the far back left-hand corner. Fits okay and seems secure. I can live with it. That's why I give it 3 stars; I like the basket shape and construction, it's easy to load, holds lots of utensils but doesn't fit perfectly.

Segments.SegmentText: I liked the weight and sturdiness of the basket.
This basket is a little large for the space set aside for the utensil basket on the middle shelf and it doesn't fit well over the spikes that are there to support it.
I like the basket shape and construction, it's easy to load, holds lots of utensils but doesn't fit perfectly.

ReviewText: This blender is powerful and can crush ice in seconds, which is great for my morning smoothie. However, it's incredibly loud, and the vibration causes it to move around on the counter.

Segments.SegmentText: However, it's incredibly loud, and the vibration causes it to move around on the counter.

ReviewText: I bought this to keep my teenager from doing constant midnight raids on the fridge. It does stick well. The wheels are a little fidigity to turn and the whole thing is just lightweight plastic. My son has a slight build and not strong at all. He forgot the lock was there and pulled and the plastic broke that holds the base of the wire and I got to see just how thin the plastic is. I bought another brand at the same time for the freezer and while it is also plastic, the quality seems better. So long story short, if you want to keep a little kid out it is probably fine but a semi determined early teen or older will get in even by accident.

Segments.SegmentText: The wheels are a little fidigity to turn and the whole thing is just lightweight plastic.
He forgot the lock was there and pulled and the plastic broke that holds the base of the wire and I got to see just how thin the plastic is.

ReviewText: I've been using this coffee maker for a few weeks now and I'm pretty satisfied with it. It brews coffee quickly and the carafe keeps it warm for a decent amount of time. However, the design could be improved. The lid doesn't open wide enough, making it difficult to fill the water reservoir without spilling. Also, the buttons are a bit finicky and sometimes require multiple presses to register.

Segments.SegmentText: It brews coffee quickly and the carafe keeps it warm for a decent amount of time.
However, the design could be improved. The lid doesn't open wide enough, making it difficult to fill the water reservoir without spilling.
Also, the buttons are a bit finicky and sometimes require multiple presses to register.

ReviewText: This vacuum cleaner has great suction power and works well on both hardwood floors and carpets. However, it's quite heavy and difficult to maneuver around furniture.

ReviewText: I purchased this toaster a few months ago and have been using it daily. It toasts bread evenly and quickly, which I love. However, the exterior gets very hot during use, which can be a safety concern, especially if you have small children around.

ReviewText: I bought this fitness tracker a month ago and it's been fantastic for keeping me motivated to exercise. The app is easy to use and provides insightful data. However, the battery life is disappointing as it needs to be charged every other day.

ReviewText: This baby monitor has been a lifesaver since we brought our newborn home. The video quality is excellent and the night vision feature works well. However, the battery life could be better as it needs to be recharged frequently.

ReviewText: I bought this toaster oven a few weeks ago and it's been a great addition to my kitchen. It cooks food evenly and has a variety of useful settings. However, the exterior gets very hot during use, so caution is needed.

ReviewText: I've been using this vacuum cleaner for a few months now and I'm quite impressed with its performance. It has strong suction and effectively picks up pet hair. However, the cord is a bit short, so I need to switch outlets frequently.

ReviewText: I bought this rice cooker last month and I'm satisfied with its performance so far. It cooks rice perfectly and is easy to clean. However, the exterior gets quite hot during use.

ReviewText: Arrived quickly and in good condition. Set up was reasonably easy and I'm not good with computers. A bit slow on receiving a print job but the quality of the prints is extremely good.

but the quality of the prints is extremely good

ReviewText: This is an amazing headset, the sound is amazing, you can hear sounds and effects you never noticed in songs you have listened to for years.

Segments.SegmentText: This is an amazing headset, the sound is amazing, you can hear sounds and effects you never noticed in songs you have listened to for years.

ReviewText: This sewing machine is perfect for beginners like me. It's easy to set up and use, and the instructional DVD was very helpful. However, the thread tension can be a bit finicky at times.

ReviewText: It's a great little watch but in my opinion it lacks battery life. Other than that, it does what it says it does.

ReviewText: This keyboard is beyond futuristic with its sleek steel bezel. I love how heavy and durable it is, Bluetooth charged, on/off switch and the fact that it lights up as soon as you put your hands on it. I also love how there’s indentations on each key for a super comfortable feel while typing. You get what you pay for. Ultra modern technology.

Segments.SegmentText: This keyboard is beyond futuristic with its sleek steel bezel.
I also love how there’s indentations on each key for a super comfortable feel while typing.

ReviewText: These are by far the best ear buds I've owned so far. Fit great. Stay in. Sound awesome. Durable. long lasting battery. Happy with this purchase.

Segments.SegmentText: long lasting battery

ReviewText: The screws that retain each of the four rollers ripped out of the nylon roller stubs after a few weeks of use. Fortunately the centers of the stubs can be drilled to accept a bolt that will pass completely thru and a nut can then be used to retain them. This will be an easy and permanent fix, but it is disappointing to have to repair new parts. Also, the Instructional pictures were poor and I needed to watch an online video to see how the parts were supposed to be assembled.

Segments.SegmentText: The screws that retain each of the four rollers ripped out of the nylon roller stubs after a few weeks of use.
Also, the Instructional pictures were poor and I needed to watch an online video to see how the parts were supposed to be assembled.

ReviewText: Filtered coffee is not as clean compared with using paper filter. (I use medium grain) On the other hand, I can't tell the difference in taste between this and the paper filter. And it is more inconvenient to use as I have to remember not to pop it into the trash can. Overall, if you are not concerned of the less environmental impact this has, it's not quite worth it.

Segments.SegmentText: On the other hand, I can't tell the difference in taste between this and the paper filter.

ReviewText: I was looking for something to take my work on the road - perfect little chromebook. Impressed with the operating system, functionality and speed for the value. Do your research and make sure it is compatible with what you need - I did not have an issue for my needs. Happy.

Segments.SegmentText: Impressed with the operating system, functionality and speed for the value.

ReviewText: I am pretty happy with the purchase of this mouse. It's a little smallish and had a strong "cheap plastic" smell coming from the rubber mouse wheel but that went away after a while. Otherwise it works great and the buttons are quieter and less "clicky" sounding than other inexpensive mice I have tried. The mouse wheel also scrolls quietly. I recommend it and would buy it again.

Segments.SegmentText: Otherwise it works great and the buttons are quieter and less "clicky" sounding than other inexpensive mice I have tried.
The mouse wheel also scrolls quietly.

ReviewText: I was able to use this replacement however it arrived bended in different places so I got online and requested a return and reorder a second one hoping the second one would be packed in a box instead of a flimsy plastic bag. The second one arrived more bended than the first one, it is made very flimsy I which they made this as sturdy as the original Replacement lens and filter. I ended up keeping the first Replacement as the second one was in worst condition (very bended). I kept it because I haven't been able to find a sturdier Replacement that could fit our hood. This item should be packed in a box to avoid getting bended.

Segments.SegmentText: The second one arrived more bended than the first one, it is made very flimsy I which they made this as sturdy as the original Replacement lens and filter.
I ended up keeping the first Replacement as the second one was in worst condition (very bended).

ReviewText: I really appreciate the convenience of this pump. I can place the water bottle in a cabinet instead of having a big dispenser out in my kitchen. However, it stopped charging already. I bought it in July 2022 and it's now March 2023. It's worth it and I will buy another one. It's just a bummer that it broke already.

Segments.SegmentText: I really appreciate the convenience of this pump. I can place the water bottle in a cabinet instead of having a big dispenser out in my kitchen.

ReviewText: Two controllers had multiple back buttons break within a month, the original purchase and my replacement. I’ve had an elite controller for 3 years and never broke a back paddle mechanism. Unfortunately Amazon won’t let me return the second in a used condition. I’m out nearly $80 for a broken controller. I have no fully functional controller now and can’t afford another. Not the seller/vendors fault, but the quality control/design on these controllers is rough. Look it up on Reddit and you’ll see many with this issue. The paddles eventually either stop clicking when pressed down, or lock up and randomly can’t be pressed. Sticks are great though.

Segments.SegmentText: Two controllers had multiple back buttons break within a month, the original purchase and my replacement
I’ve had an elite controller for 3 years and never broke a back paddle mechanism.
Not the seller/vendors fault, but the quality control/design on these controllers is rough.
Sticks are great though.

ReviewText: I really want this to work. I don't know what I am doing wrong, but I get tons of grounds in the coffee cup. I am using Starbucks pre-ground coffee. I have tried this a lot of times always with the same result. Help! I have had to strain the coffee after it brews just to get the grounds out.

Segments.SegmentText: I get tons of grounds in the coffee cup.

ReviewText: The picture is great, the sound is good. It’s light weight and certainly made a huge difference in my designing. I had a bit of a struggle securing the stand to the back but now that it’s durable, I’m very happy I bought this. Also, good price too.

Segments.SegmentText: The picture is great, the sound is good.
It’s light weight and certainly made a huge difference in my designing.
Also, good price too.

ReviewText: I recently purchased a Keurig and had a lot of coffee left from my old drip brew machine. I purchased the Eco-Fill pods in order to use up that coffee. They are accomplishing that but I will not continue using them after the coffee is gone due to the design. The lids do not stay closed during the brewing process. Sometimes you end up with coffee grounds in the bottom of your cup or under the pod. I have tried several different methods of making the lids stay closed but so far, I haven't found a foolproof solution.

Segments.SegmentText: The lids do not stay closed during the brewing process. Sometimes you end up with coffee grounds in the bottom of your cup or under the pod.
They are accomplishing that but I will not continue using them after the coffee is gone due to the design.
